Description: Format to use for dates. "Original" is the date as entered by the user; other values will normalize all date/time input to the selected standard format.
Options: Valid values are text, delimited, iso8601, and original. The default is text.

Description: You may output or omit the time portion of date time expressions.
If set to a non-zero value commas are included after the day in a US-style (month first) text date
Format to use for times. "12" displays as, for example, 3:15 PM, where "24" would display at 15:15PM.
If true dates ranging over uniform quarter centuries, such as 1900-1925 or 1975-2000 will be output in the format "20 Q1" eg. 1st quarter of 20th century, or 1900-1925.
If true century only dates (eg "18th century") will be output in roman numerals like "XVIIIth century".
Delimiter in time display; must be valid for the current language or default will be used; Default is first delimiter in language config file.
Text to put between times in a range; must be valid for the current language or default will be used; default is first in language config.
Text to place before date/times in a range; must be valid for the current language or default will be used. Default is none.
Text to place between date/times in a range; must be valid for the current language or default will be used.
Text to put between times in a range; must be valid for the current language or default will be used; default is first in language config.
If set to a non-zero value the "AD" era will be show for all dates; default is to only show it in ranges that span era
Text to use to indicate date is uncertain; must be valid for the current language or default will be used.
Text to place before date/times in a range; must be valid for the current language or default will be used. Default is none.
Text to place before date/times to indicate it is a "circa", or uncertain, date. Must be valid for the current language or default will be used.
Text to place before a date/time to indicate that it is no later than the specified date; must be valid for the current language or default will be used.
Text to place before a date/time to indicate that it is no earlier than the specified date; must be valid for the current language or default will be used.
Text that represents the current date; must be valid for the current language or default will be used.
